structured_data.professional_summary: Cybersecurity professional with experience in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment and risk management. Strong military background provides a unique perspective on layered defense and how to get around them. Proven track record in leading technical projects, troubleshooting complex issues, and communicating technical issues.

experience.responsibilities: Volunteer position where I created CTFs and labs using Virtual Machines to help my fellow Cyber Security students hone their Offensive Security skills

experience.job_title: Senior Staff Officer – Simulation and Modelling
experience.responsibilities: Responsible for Simulation & Modelling for the Royal Canadian Navy (RCN). Managed the upgrade project of a classified network worth $40 million, resulting in net progress towards modernizing the RCN.

Provided oversight for the trades training of all Weapons Engineering Technician and Combat Systems Engineering Officers of the East Coast fleet. Provided mentoring, supervision and coaching of 40 staff, leading to a successful throughput of approximately 120 students per year.

Responsible for military HR, IT, and security of a 1000 person unit focused on ship repair and maintenance. Managed a team of 7 personnel (military and civilian), ensuring that operational risks were managed adequately and maintenance of the ships proceeded smoothly.

Responsible for the Security, IT, Scheduling, Purchasing, Safety & Environment, and Equipment Maintenance of the school. Supervised 8 section heads and managed 60 personnel to ensure that training was continuous for approximately 600 students per year going through trades training. Risk managed any potential disruption to training to keep down-time to a minimum.

Responsible for the maintenance and mission readiness of all Combat Systems aboard HMCS Ville de Quebec. Managed a department of 60 technicians to ensure that all required systems were maintained and managed risk to minimize equipment down-time, resulting in a successful counter-drug patrol in the Caribbean Basin.

experience.job_title: Staff Officer (Minor Warships and Auxiliary Vessels)
experience.responsibilities: Responsible for equipment upgrade projects and maintenance pertaining to Minor War Vessels of the RCN. Managed multi-million dollar upgrade projects, resulting in a satellite communication upgrade for the KINGSTON class Maritime Coastal Defense Vessels.

Trained to act as Head of Combat Systems Engineering Department aboard HALIFAX class Frigates, Unit Radiation Safety Officer, Unit General Safety Officer, Unit Demolitions Officer, Unit Ammunition Officer and Unit Laser Safety Officer. Accumulated 300 sea days deploying to the Gulf of Aden and the Arctic Ocean.

volunteer_experience.description: Created CTFs and labs using Virtual Machines to help fellow Cyber Security students hone their Offensive Security skills.

years_exp: 20+ years of experience in Military Leadership and Cybersecurity
profile:
Philippe Nault is a highly skilled cybersecurity professional with a robust background in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and risk management. With a unique combination of technical expertise and leadership experience from his distinguished military career, he brings a deep understanding of layered defense strategies and innovative ways to overcome security challenges. Philippe is currently pursuing a Cyber Security Diploma at Nova Scotia Community College (NSCC), where he leads the Offensive Security Club, designing Capture The Flag (CTF) challenges and virtual labs to enhance his peers' offensive security skills.

Over the course of his career, Philippe has demonstrated exceptional leadership and project management abilities across various roles within the Royal Canadian Navy. Notably, he managed a $40 million network upgrade project, modernizing critical simulation systems for the Maritime Warfare Center. As an Executive Officer at Fleet Maintenance Facility Cape Scott, he guided a team of military and civilian personnel in maintaining operational readiness for naval vessels. His technical accomplishments also include overseeing multimillion-dollar satellite communication upgrades for Maritime Coastal Defense Vessels and ensuring combat systems readiness during counter-drug patrol missions in the Caribbean Basin.

Philippe is proficient in a wide array of tools and techniques, including Kali Linux, Metasploit, Nmap, and Active Directory exploitation, making him adept at vulnerability scanning, privilege escalation, and web application exploitation. He holds the prestigious Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP) certification and is fluent in English and French. With a Bachelor’s degree in Chemical and Materials Engineering from the Royal Military College of Canada, he combines analytical thinking with hands-on technical expertise. Philippe continues to make an impact as a mentor, innovator, and leader in the cybersecurity field, leveraging his skills to drive results and develop the next generation of security professionals.

responsibilities: Developed Capture the Flag (CTF) challenges and labs utilizing Virtual Machines to enhance learning experiences.
Guided Cyber Security students in improving their knowledge and skills in Offensive Security techniques.

other_experience.position_title: Senior Staff Officer – Simulation and Modelling
responsibilities: Directed a $40 million classified network upgrade project with a focus on security and modernization.
Played a critical role in updating the Royal Canadian Navy's infrastructure to align with modern standards.
Managed training programs for Weapons Engineering Technicians and Combat Systems Engineering Officers.
Supervised and mentored a team of 40 staff members, ensuring the successful training of 120 students annually.
Oversaw HR, IT, and security operations for a 1000-person unit specializing in ship repair and maintenance.
Led a 7-member team to efficiently manage operational risks and ensure smooth ship maintenance processes.
Directed security, IT, scheduling, purchasing, safety, and equipment maintenance for the school.
Supervised 8 section heads and managed 60 staff members to ensure uninterrupted training for 600 students annually.
Mitigated risks to prevent training disruptions and minimize operational downtime.
Ensured operational readiness of all Combat Systems aboard the ship to support mission success.
Managed a team of 60 technicians to minimize equipment downtime and maintain system functionality.
Contributed to a successful counter-drug operation in the Caribbean Basin through effective system management.

other_experience.position_title: Staff Officer (Minor Warships and Auxiliary Vessels)
responsibilities: Led equipment upgrade projects and maintenance for Minor War Vessels within the Royal Canadian Navy.
Executed multi-million dollar projects, including a satellite communication upgrade for Maritime Coastal Defense Vessels.
Completed training to lead the Combat Systems Engineering Department aboard HALIFAX class Frigates.
Served in specialized roles including Radiation Safety Officer and Ammunition Officer to ensure safety compliance.
Accumulated 300 sea days, deploying to critical operations in the Gulf of Aden and Arctic Ocean.
Designed and created Capture The Flag (CTF) challenges and labs using Virtual Machines.
Facilitated skill development in offensive security for fellow cybersecurity students.
